script.speaker: Sundar Pichai
script.text: Next up, we have Andrea, a Google Data Engineer from London, originally from Milan, Italy.  He's passionate about music and data, and tonight, he's combining both! Andrea's prepared a unique acoustic rendition of Queen's 'Somebody to Love,' but with a data-driven twist.  He's dedicating this performance to Sara. Andrea, break a leg!

script.speaker: Participant
script.text: START PERFORMANCE - Andrea performs his data-themed rendition of 'Somebody to Love.'

script.speaker: Billie Joe Armstrong
script.text: Okay, I was not expecting that! 'Find some data to flow?'  That's dedication to the day job, man!

script.speaker: Dave Grohl
script.text: You're right, Billie, that was unexpected.  But hey, gotta respect the originality. Freddie would've cracked a smile, I think.

script.speaker: Alanis Morissette
script.text: Andrea, the dedication to Sara was very sweet.  And you know how to work those data lyrics!  It's a unique approach to a classic.

script.speaker: Sara Bareilles
script.text: Well, thank you for the dedication, Andrea. I appreciate the risk you took with the arrangement.  Very brave!

script.speaker: Sundar Pichai
script.text: Data and rock and roll - who knew they could go together?  So, judges, what's the verdict?

script.speaker: Billie Joe Armstrong
script.text: I gotta hand it to you, man, that was bold.  It wasn't my cup of tea, but I admire the guts. It's a yes from me!

script.speaker: Dave Grohl
script.text: I'm with Billie on this one.  Points for creativity, but I need a bit more 'Somebody to Love' and a little less 'data.'  It's a no from me.

script.speaker: Alanis Morissette
script.text: I loved the passion, Andrea, and I think you've got a great voice.  It's a yes from me!

script.speaker: Sara Bareilles
script.text: I'm going to say yes, too, Andrea.  I admire your courage to be different.

script.speaker: Sundar Pichai
script.text: Three yeses!  Looks like the data flow continues for you, Andrea. Congratulations!
